description.narrative: Newton Fund in Vietnam aims at promoting international collaborations and developing career for researchers and institutions. The programme focuses on the following Vietnam’s prioritised areas: Health and life sciences; Agriculture; Environment and energy; Future cities; Digital Innovation and creativity. No funding has been awarded for 2021-2022 however activities are still ongoing through 2021-2022 due to impact of COVID. On-going projects are Researcher Environment Links and Institutional Links, which aim at supporting international collaboration through training programmes, the exchange of knowledge and best practice, the development and implementation of pilot activities in the areas relevant to the Newton capacity building strands; and facilitating research that tackles local development challenges.

Newton in Vietnam has been supported by government and national funding organisations: Ministry of Science and Technology, National Foundation for Science and Technology Development (NAFOSTED) since 2014.

The Newton Fund builds research and innovation partnerships with partner countries to support their economic development and social welfare, and to develop their research and innovation capacity for long-term sustainable growth. The fund is managed by the UK’s Department of Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy, and delivered through 7 UK delivery partners . It has a total UK government investment of £735 million up until 2021, with matched resources from partner countries. The Newton Fund covers three broad activities including People, Research and Translation. In Vietnam the British Council has been partnering with Vietnamese government organisations and funding bodies to deliver the People strand since 2014.
Vietnamese government organisations, national funding organisations. UK and Vietnamese universities, research institutes. Researchers from UK and Vietnamese universities and institutes.
